abstract: Author Edith Pearlman, who emerged from obscurity in 2011 after 40 years of writing short stories, is finally picked up by major publishing house; Little, Brown is set to release her collection Honeydew two years after she began cancer treatments that have left her too weak to write.
lead_paragraph: The writer Edith Pearlman is enjoying a commercial breakthrough at 78, with her first story collection to be published by a major house.

headline.main: For Writer, Talent Finally Succeeds Where Chance Failed
